name: drape
content:
drape something across, on, over, etc. something
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put something such as cloth or a piece of clothing loosely over something: He draped his jacket over the back of the chair and sat down to eat.
See more be draped in/with something
to be loosely covered with a cloth: The coffins were all draped with the national flag.
See more
Idiom
draped all over someone
the way in which cloth folds or hangs as it covers something: She liked the heavy drape of velvet. drapes [ plural ] US (also draperies)
heavy curtains made with thick cloth: These drapes will need to be professionally cleaned.
